findings.title: ELFM - Exceeds Fees Limit
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to increase over the allowed limit of 25%. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `setsellTaxes` function with a high percentage value. As a result, the fees may be configured up to 50%.

findings.title: ZD - Zero Division
findings.description: The contract does not handle division by zero appropriately, which can lead to unintended behavior and compromise the reliability and safety of the contract.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but if `minimumTokensBeforeSwap` is set to a big number, it may trigger a huge token swap, leading to significant price volatility due to the token's highly volatile price.

findings.title: PTRP - Potential Transfer Revert Propagation
findings.description: The contract does not tolerate potential reverts from underlying contracts during main transfer flow.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword. This means that the value of the state variable cannot be changed after it has been set. Additionally, the constant variables decrease gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: Non-conformance to Solidity naming conventions affects code readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can decrease contract clarity and efficiency.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: Validate variable setters to ensure secure smart contract functionality.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Usage of solidity assembly can make code difficult to read and understand.
